intro: Tricoryne acaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed trichocoryne, is a unique member of the Araliaceae family. It is a low-growing, herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often lobed or serrated. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on short, hairy peduncles. Tricoryne acaulis is native to tropical regions of Africa and is adapted to grow in shaded, humid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
